parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From dokimos; to test; by implication, to approve.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
From pseudes and prophetes; a spurious prophet, i.e. Pretended foreteller or religious impostor.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
